name: New Forest loop
descrip: Start in lyndhurst - down to the coast and back via brockenhurst. The route explores beautiful parts of the New Forest and you will likely see the New Forest ponies or other wildlife. There are plenty of great spots to stop for a picnic or cream tea in one of the many welcoming tea rooms - all surrounded by the most amazing scenery.
imgAlt: Sunny tarmac road through the forest

name: North Downs Loop
descrip: This route is part of the North Downs Way, which is a 150 mile cycle from Farnham to Dover. Ride through Ranmore Common, along dirt/gravel trails. This mountain bike primary trail can be used both directions and includes challenging climbs. Some great views from the higher parts of the ride, with two great cafe stops!
imgAlt: Wooden signpost infront of grass fields

name: Bracknell Circular
descrip: A great route that goes through forest paths, overall well pathed and suitable for beginners. As this is a relatively flat route that includes sections through woodland on well-maintained trails, this ride would benefit families or riders of all abilities. Picnic areas are available and reguarly used but kept tidy.

name: London Bridge
descrip: This is mainly a thames riverside route with large parts of the route off the roads and great pubs along the way. Note that only parts of Greenwich park are accessible by bike so be careful where you cycle.
imgAlt: London bridge straight ahead on road

name: Dalston to Chigwell
descrip: A delightful ride away from the chaos, into the countryside and posh suburbs with mansion-lined roads. Some quiet lanes and relatively low elevation make this ride ideal for beginners wanting to try a longer ride or intermediates wanting a scenic jolly.
imgAlt: Swan in pond, infront of large white buildings

name: Reading Circular
descrip: A very nice route - if ridden counter clockwise all the best climbs are within the last 20 km. Within Ashampstead is Vickers Game which is a farm shop that do bacon rolls, coffee and cakes - with an outside seating area, perfect for a mid-ride re-fuel.
imgAlt: Path through park, with trees surrounding

name: Richmond Park loop
descrip: A family friendly cycling loop via Putney Heath-Wimbledon Common-Richmond Park. This route passes through some interesting spots, where you will likely pass the famous Richmond Park deer grazing. On the common you can expect flat, car-free roads, which are ideal for less confident riders. There are many facilities at Richmond Park including parking, toilets and cafes/snack bars.
imgAlt: Path through park, with trees surrounding

name: A Tour of Rothschildshire
descrip: This is a tour around the fabulous mansions that the extended banking dynasty built here. The route is mostly flat and on-road with a few undemanding climbs. At Eythrope there is also a temporary need to use a gated footpath for a few hundred metres. Other sights on the route include the site of the Great Train Robbery 1963 and a WW2 secret weapons lab.
imgAlt: Grand mansion with flower-filled front garden
